newsitem.title: CHILE: France, Chile look to boost trade, cultural ties.
newsitem.headline: France, Chile look to boost trade, cultural ties.

text.p: Chile and France will concentrate on strengthening trade and cultural ties during President Eduardo Frei's visit to Paris next week, French Ambassador Gerard Cros said on Tuesday.

"For us the first emphasis is to increase France's economic presence in this country, which is not bad but could be better," Cros told reporters after a meeting with Foreign Minister Jose Miguel Insulza. "I believe President Frei's speeches in Paris will be very useful to convince French businessmen to invest here."

Frei will visit France from April 10-11, holding talks with French President Jacques Chirac and addressing the French chamber of commerce. His trip comes just weeks after a high-profile visit by Chirac to Latin America, including stops in Brazil and Argentina, which was aimed at boosting French trade and investment in the region.
The two leaders will sign at least eight bilateral accords including agreements between both countries' diplomatic academies, on technical co-operation and television.

France is Chile's fourth largest trading partner in Europe with bilateral trade totalling nearly $1 billion in 1995. The balance is in favour of Chile. Main Chilean exports to France include copper, fresh fruit and seafood.
